result.execSummary:
The defendant Joan Michelle Tauer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joan Michelle Tauer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joan Michelle Tauer was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Report to probation by 1:00 pm on 6/16/22. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 21CM402, 21CM456, 21CM496, 21CM653, 21CM671, 22CM21 & 22CM271 (PLEAS):
CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:  Michelle P Brekken   DF ATTY:  Derek W Sanders   DF:  Joan Michelle Tauer appeared. Case called at 10:02 a.m. Court notes these matters are set for plea and sentencing. ADA Brekken recites agreement. State is in compliance with Victims Rights.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to amended Ct 1 Battery without enhancer in 21CM402.  DE pleads NO CONTEST to Ct. 1 Misd. Bail Jumping in 21CM456, Ct.1 Misd. Bail Jumping in 21CM496, Ct. 3 Possession of THC in 22CM21 and Ct. 1 Misd. Bail Jumping in 22CM271. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 Battery without enhancer in 21CM402, Ct. 1 Misd. Bail Jumping in 21CM456, Ct.1 Misd. Bail Jumping in 21CM496, Ct. 3 Possession of THC in 22CM21 and Ct. 1 Misd. Bail Jumping in 22CM271. Count 2 in 21CM402, Ct's 2-7 in 21CM496, Ct's 4-7 in 22CM21, and files 21CM653 & 21CM671 are dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct's 1 & 2 in 22CM21. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to appeal. Court will reserve on jail credit. Court adjourned at 10:17 a.m.

- S/W 2 years. Report to Probation no later than 1 p.m. today. Run concurrent to all other counts.
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections
- Court costs of $243.00. Payment plan of $50.00 per month beginning August 1. 
- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $200.00.
- 40 hours of community service
- No contact with Timothy W., his residence or place of employment without Agent approval.
- AODA and follow through with recommendations
- Absolute Sobriety

- Comply with recommendations of Domestic Violence Assessment.

Includes 21CM402, 21CM456, 21CM496, 21CM653, 21CM671, and 22CM21.

- Defendant to report to Justice Support Center for testing Upon Release. 

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

-   It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  T.D.W.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

Defendant to contact Restorative Services at 715-425-1100 to scheduled Domestic Violence Assessment.
